item.title: Volkswagen’s electric ID Buzz van will start at $59,995 in the US
item.description:
Volkswagen has taken one of the final steps toward delivering the ID Buzz in the US by announcing pricing, battery range, and initial options available at launch later this year. The ID Buzz will start at $59,995 for a Pro S model that comes standard with RWD and, crucially, seven seats, as it’s the bigger, long-wheelbase version previously confirmed for the American market.

The 2025 ID Buzz now has a finalized EPA-estimated range of 234 miles for RWD models and 231 miles on the 4Motion AWD ones — well under some expected guesses of 300 or so miles on a single charge for a vehicle that has a sizable 91kWh battery.

The next model up is the Pro S Plus, which starts at $63,495 for RWD with bench seating standard and $67,995...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Umar Shakir

item.title: Ford says a pickup truck will be the first EV built on its low-cost platform
item.description:
The first vehicle that will be built on the low-cost EV platform Ford’s been developing in secret will be a mid-size pickup due out in 2027, the automaker announced Wednesday morning. The news comes as part of a much larger rewriting of Ford’s electrification plans. The company is abandoning a plan to make an all-electric […]

item.title: UK’s competition authority ends probes of Apple and Google but will use incoming powers to ‘resolve app store concerns’
item.description:
Apple and Google can take a breath after the U.K. competition watchdog announced Wednesday it’s closing a pair of investigations into their respective mobile app ecosystems, citing administrative priorities. Since March 2021, the U.K. regulator had been investigating Apple’s conduct in relation to the distribution of apps on its iOS and iPadOS mobile devices, with […]

item.title: Story raises $83M at $2.25B valuation to build a blockchain for the business of content IP in the age of AI
item.description:
AI giants like Anthropic, OpenAI and Stability AI have faced a lot of heat over how they’ve scraped data and rode rough-shod over others’ intellectual property when training and operating their foundational models. Now, a startup called Story — which today is announcing $83 million in funding — is bidding to rebalance the scales with […]

item.description: Production at the new plant in Tennessee was initially expected to begin next year.

item.description: If you're not the best at writing emails, Gmail's latest Gemini-powered update "Polish" could sort you out.
